        public boolean afterStartDate(java.util.Date inDate)

        Returns:

        See Also:

      • getDaysOfTheWeekToComplete

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDaysOfTheWeekToComplete()
        Gets the days of the week where we want to complete the habit. Days of the week are represented by the integers i.e [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] where 1 represents Monday, 2 represents Tuesday, ..... , 7 represents Sunday.
        Returns:
        daysOfTheWeekToComplete - list of integers that represents the days of the week to complete habit on

      • checkDay

        public java.lang.Boolean checkDay(int day)
        Checks if a weekday is in the days of week to complete
        Parameters:
        day -
        Returns:
        if on scheduled weekday, true
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Habit

      • setDaysOfTheWeekToComplete

        public void setDaysOfTheWeekToComplete(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> daysToComplete)
        Sets the days of the week where we want to complete the habit i.e if we schedule the habit to be completed on mondays and wednesday then the array will contain [1,3]. Days of the week are represented by integers.

      • getCompletedEvents

      • setCompletedEvents

        public void setCompletedEvents(java.util.List<HabitEvent> completions)

      • addPassedDayCount

        public void addPassedDayCount(java.util.Date start,
                              java.util.Date end,
                              java.lang.Boolean real,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Date> skipDays)
        Adds the scheduled days of the week passed since last login, aka between two user inputed dates, and adds as missed days. Fake days is the the scheduled days of the week passed since last login when still online
        Since:
        1.0
